title: Pipefitter (contract)
description:
Requisition ID: 26649

Do you want to work at one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers? We’re looking for people who are driven by excellence to work with innovative technology to create the material tomorrow’s world will be made of.

At ArcelorMittal Dofasco, we play a key role in North America’s advanced manufacturing supply chain working with the top automotive, energy, packaging, and construction brands to develop lighter, stronger and more sustainable steel products – from cans to cars.

We are at the forefront of the steel industry with a plan to change the way we make steel to significantly reduce GHG emissions in the short term, while reaching net zero before 2050. Ours will be the first integrated steelmaking site in the world to make this transformation and it will happen by 2028. Our global company is leading the world with significant decarbonization projects in North America and Europe and our site is key to this plan.

ArcelorMittal Dofasco is Hamilton's largest private sector employer with more than 4,500 employees, shipping 4.5 million net tons of high quality flat carbon steel annually. Our iconic tagline "Our Product is Steel. Our Strength is People. is a true expression of our belief that our people are our competitive advantage.

Steamfitter / Pipefitter

We are looking for results driven licensed Steamfitter/Pipefitters who want to be part of our progressive maintenance team. Individuals who want to work in a safety driven environment, who can effeciently and effectively execute all aspects of the Steamfitter or Pipefitter trade. The successful candidate will be part of a team performing maintenance functions on an as needed basis. As a Steamfitter/Pipefitter you will be required to work effectively with others in a team environment, apply problem-solving methodologies and demonstrate a continuous improvement orientation by seeking new innovative methods of maintaining related processes.

Steamfitters or Pipefitters applying for opportunities will be considered for roles based on previous skills and experience and will be assigned to one of the two groups.

Central Trades and Services (CTS) Field

Our Central Trades and Services (CTS) Field team consists of several different groups that are based out of the various Business Units across the plant. The field groups encompass multiple tradespersons who are responsible for carrying out shutdown execution work, daily preventative maintenance tasks as well as shutdown prep/post work.

Asset Maintenance

Our asset tradespeople are dedicated to one of our production asset teams where they are responsible for the equipment in these areas. These asset areas include Cokemaking, Ironmaking, Steelmaking, Material Handling and Logistics, Hot Mill, Cold Roll Tin, Galvanize, Utilities, Pickling and Cold Rolling. Millwrights assigned to an asset team responsible for ensuring the reliability of our production facilities which includes daily preventative maintenance tasks as well as shutdown prep/post work.

What You'll Do

  • Perform mechanical maintenance functions on all equipment required to produce quality products for operating facilities within the Business Unit
  • Performing reactive work, trouble shooting and repairing production equipment on a daily basis, preventing or reducing unplanned equipment delays
  • Perform inspections, repairs, rebuilds in both shop and plant environment
  • Maintain, troubleshoot & repair hydraulic systems, once through and closed loop cooling water systems, and the various gas systems within the Business Unit
  • Read/interpret drawings and specifications; interpret mechanical and construction drawings; prepare material lists; perform trade calculations
  • Install and maintain steam, fire protection, piping, hydraulic, pneumatic, environmental, process water, sanitary, codes, acts and regulations to company standards
  • Determine materials and fabrication procedures; field check and verify site drawings to company and industry standard

What You'll Bring

  • Ontario 307A Steamfitter Certificate of Qualification or Interprovincial Red Seal is required
  • Ontario College of Trades membership is required
  • High school diploma or academic equivalent is required
  • Advanced trouble-shooting and problem-solving skills
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Basic personal computer skills (MS Word, Excel, Outlook)
  • Capable of physically demanding work (both indoors and outdoors)
  • Self-starter with the ability to follow directions and work in a team environment with minimal supervision
  • Knowledge of fluid power is an asset
  • TSSA G2 or IMT tickets are considered an asset
  • Experience with backflow preventers is considered an asset
  • Valid Ontario Driver’s license is considered an asset

Where You'll Work

  • Heavy industrial environment, requiring 100% of time per week in plant
  • Required to wear personal protective equipment
  • The use of respirators, fresh air breathing apparatus and standard plant safety equipment may also be required
  • Exposure to noise, heights, confined spaces, lighting conditions, materials, products and by-products associated with the manufacture of steel, temperature and weather extremes that require the use of specialized protective devices or equipment
  • Required to climb stairs, ladders and scaffolding to access elevations, able to crouch for periods of time, push, pull, lift and turn while carrying tools, material and equipment in various parts of the facilities

When You'll Work
  • 8- Hour Day Shift - Core Hours are Monday to Friday (6:30 AM - 3:00 PM)
  • Candidates must be willing to work outside of core hours as required for shutdowns, emergency breakdown work and call-in support.
    • Rescheduled shifts could include days, afternoons, nights (8 hour and 12 hour shifts
Why You'll Love Working Here

  • Health and Safety is Paramount
  • We believe in working together to achieve collective success
  • We expect and value high performance recognizing and rewarding it
  • Opportunities to grow your career locally or globally
  • We offer a diverse and inclusive workplace where all team members are valued and treated respectfully
  • Collectively, we create an environment that maximizes engagement of our energy and efforts
  • All personal protective equipment provided (including prescription safety glasses and work boots)
  • Multiple On-Site Fitness Facilities with Health and Wellness programs available
  • 70-Acre Recreation Park with organized sports leagues and clubs for you and your family

What We Offer You

  • We provide employees with a market competitive total compensation package. Our promise is to provide superior pay for superior performance, accompanied by comprehensive health and wellness, pension, vacation and related programs.
  • Competitive hourly rates and shift premium
  • On your first day you will immediately be eligible for:
  • Bonus paid twice a year based on Company performance on key goals. Your bonus target will be 10% of base salary earnings.
  • Company paid Defined Contribution Pension Plan. No employee contribution required. With employer contributions between 5 and 10%.
  • Competitive vacation allowances
  • Group Benefits with no health and dental premiums.
    • For health and dental claims you only pay amounts above the maximums the plan pays.
    • Life insurance premiums are shared with the company.
After two years of permanent company service you will participate in our Profit Sharing, where all permanent employees share equally in allocation of profits.

Other Immediate Benefits Include

  • Competitive vacation entitlements
  • PPE and workwear provided at no cost (if required)
  • Wellness and Employee Assistance Programs
  • Free access to three onsite fitness centers and our 70-acre recreation park with multiple arenas, fields and organized sports for you and your family

We would like to thank all those who apply in advance since only applicants selected to complete an online assessment will be contacted.

ArcelorMittal Dofasco is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all qualified candidates to apply and we are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities to support their participation in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.   • Read/interpret drawings and specifications; interpret mechanical and construction drawings; prepare material lists; perform trade calculations
  • Install and maintain steam, fire protection, piping, hydraulic, pneumatic, environmental, process water, sanitary, codes, acts and regulations to company standards
  • Determine materials and fabrication procedures; field check and verify site drawings to company and industry standard

What You'll Bring

  • Ontario 307A Steamfitter Certificate of Qualification or Interprovincial Red Seal is required
  • Ontario College of Trades membership is required
  • High school diploma or academic equivalent is required
  • Advanced trouble-shooting and problem-solving skills
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Basic personal computer skills (MS Word, Excel, Outlook)
  • Capable of physically demanding work (both indoors and outdoors)
  • Self-starter with the ability to follow directions and work in a team environment with minimal supervision
  • Knowledge of fluid power is an asset
  • TSSA G2 or IMT tickets are considered an asset
  • Experience with backflow preventers is considered an asset
  • Valid Ontario Driver’s license is considered an asset

Where You'll Work

  • Heavy industrial environment, requiring 100% of time per week in plant
  • Required to wear personal protective equipment
  • The use of respirators, fresh air breathing apparatus and standard plant safety equipment may also be required
  • Exposure to noise, heights, confined spaces, lighting conditions, materials, products and by-products associated with the manufacture of steel, temperature and weather extremes that require the use of specialized protective devices or equipment
  • Required to climb stairs, ladders and scaffolding to access elevations, able to crouch for periods of time, push, pull, lift and turn while carrying tools, material and equipment in various parts of the facilities

When You'll Work
  • 8- Hour Day Shift - Core Hours are Monday to Friday (6:30 AM - 3:00 PM)
  • Candidates must be willing to work outside of core hours as required for shutdowns, emergency breakdown work and call-in support.
    • Rescheduled shifts could include days, afternoons, nights (8 hour and 12 hour shifts
Why You'll Love Working Here

  • Health and Safety is Paramount
  • We believe in working together to achieve collective success
  • We expect and value high performance recognizing and rewarding it
  • Opportunities to grow your career locally or globally
  • We offer a diverse and inclusive workplace where all team members are valued and treated respectfully
  • Collectively, we create an environment that maximizes engagement of our energy and efforts
  • All personal protective equipment provided (including prescription safety glasses and work boots)
  • Multiple On-Site Fitness Facilities with Health and Wellness programs available
  • 70-Acre Recreation Park with organized sports leagues and clubs for you and your family

What We Offer You

  • We provide employees with a market competitive total compensation package. Our promise is to provide superior pay for superior performance, accompanied by comprehensive health and wellness, pension, vacation and related programs.
  • Competitive hourly rates and shift premium
  • On your first day you will immediately be eligible for:
  • Bonus paid twice a year based on Company performance on key goals. Your bonus target will be 10% of base salary earnings.
  • Company paid Defined Contribution Pension Plan. No employee contribution required. With employer contributions between 5 and 10%.
  • Competitive vacation allowances
  • Group Benefits with no health and dental premiums.
    • For health and dental claims you only pay amounts above the maximums the plan pays.
    • Life insurance premiums are shared with the company.
After two years of permanent company service you will participate in our Profit Sharing, where all permanent employees share equally in allocation of profits.

Other Immediate Benefits Include

  • Competitive vacation entitlements
  • PPE and workwear provided at no cost (if required)
  • Wellness and Employee Assistance Programs
  • Free access to three onsite fitness centers and our 70-acre recreation park with multiple arenas, fields and organized sports for you and your family

We would like to thank all those who apply in advance since only applicants selected to complete an online assessment will be contacted.

ArcelorMittal Dofasco is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all qualified candidates to apply and we are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities to support their participation in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. The field groups encompass multiple tradespersons who are responsible for carrying out shutdown execution work, daily preventative maintenance tasks as well as shutdown prep/post work.

Asset Maintenance

Our asset tradespeople are dedicated to one of our production asset teams where they are responsible for the equipment in these areas. These asset areas include Cokemaking, Ironmaking, Steelmaking, Material Handling and Logistics, Hot Mill, Cold Roll Tin, Galvanize, Utilities, Pickling and Cold Rolling. Millwrights assigned to an asset team responsible for ensuring the reliability of our production facilities which includes daily preventative maintenance tasks as well as shutdown prep/post work.

What You'll Do

  • Perform mechanical maintenance functions on all equipment required to produce quality products for operating facilities within the Business Unit
  • Performing reactive work, trouble shooting and repairing production equipment on a daily basis, preventing or reducing unplanned equipment delays
  • Perform inspections, repairs, rebuilds in both shop and plant environment
  • Maintain, troubleshoot & repair hydraulic systems, once through and closed loop cooling water systems, and the various gas systems within the Business Unit
  • Read/interpret drawings and specifications; interpret mechanical and construction drawings; prepare material lists; perform trade calculations
  • Install and maintain steam, fire protection, piping, hydraulic, pneumatic, environmental, process water, sanitary, codes, acts and regulations to company standards
  • Determine materials and fabrication procedures; field check and verify site drawings to company and industry standard

What You'll Bring

  • Ontario 307A Steamfitter Certificate of Qualification or Interprovincial Red Seal is required
  • Ontario College of Trades membership is required
  • High school diploma or academic equivalent is required
  • Advanced trouble-shooting and problem-solving skills
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills
  • Basic personal computer skills (MS Word, Excel, Outlook)
  • Capable of physically demanding work (both indoors and outdoors)
  • Self-starter with the ability to follow directions and work in a team environment with minimal supervision
  • Knowledge of fluid power is an asset
  • TSSA G2 or IMT tickets are considered an asset
  • Experience with backflow preventers is considered an asset
  • Valid Ontario Driver’s license is considered an asset

Where You'll Work

  • Heavy industrial environment, requiring 100% of time per week in plant
  • Required to wear personal protective equipment
  • The use of respirators, fresh air breathing apparatus and standard plant safety equipment may also be required
  • Exposure to noise, heights, confined spaces, lighting conditions, materials, products and by-products associated with the manufacture of steel, temperature and weather extremes that require the use of specialized protective devices or equipment
  • Required to climb stairs, ladders and scaffolding to access elevations, able to crouch for periods of time, push, pull, lift and turn while carrying tools, material and equipment in various parts of the facilities

When You'll Work
  • 8- Hour Day Shift - Core Hours are Monday to Friday (6:30 AM - 3:00 PM)
  • Candidates must be willing to work outside of core hours as required for shutdowns, emergency breakdown work and call-in support.
    • Rescheduled shifts could include days, afternoons, nights (8 hour and 12 hour shifts
Why You'll Love Working Here

  • Health and Safety is Paramount
  • We believe in working together to achieve collective success
  • We expect and value high performance recognizing and rewarding it
  • Opportunities to grow your career locally or globally
  • We offer a diverse and inclusive workplace where all team members are valued and treated respectfully
  • Collectively, we create an environment that maximizes engagement of our energy and efforts
  • All personal protective equipment provided (including prescription safety glasses and work boots)
  • Multiple On-Site Fitness Facilities with Health and Wellness programs available
  • 70-Acre Recreation Park with organized sports leagues and clubs for you and your family

What We Offer You

  • We provide employees with a market competitive total compensation package. Our promise is to provide superior pay for superior performance, accompanied by comprehensive health and wellness, pension, vacation and related programs.
  • Competitive hourly rates and shift premium
  • On your first day you will immediately be eligible for:
  • Bonus paid twice a year based on Company performance on key goals. Your bonus target will be 10% of base salary earnings.
  • Company paid Defined Contribution Pension Plan. No employee contribution required. With employer contributions between 5 and 10%.
  • Competitive vacation allowances
  • Group Benefits with no health and dental premiums.
    • For health and dental claims you only pay amounts above the maximums the plan pays.
    • Life insurance premiums are shared with the company.
After two years of permanent company service you will participate in our Profit Sharing, where all permanent employees share equally in allocation of profits.

Other Immediate Benefits Include

  • Competitive vacation entitlements
  • PPE and workwear provided at no cost (if required)
  • Wellness and Employee Assistance Programs
  • Free access to three onsite fitness centers and our 70-acre recreation park with multiple arenas, fields and organized sports for you and your family

We would like to thank all those who apply in advance since only applicants selected to complete an online assessment will be contacted.

ArcelorMittal Dofasco is an equal opportunity employer and encourages all qualified candidates to apply and we are committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities to support their participation in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Reinforcing Steel Ironworkers
description:
A&H Vancouver is looking for experienced Foremen, Journeymen, and skilled Apprentices to join our field team. You will be provided with the necessary tickets and training to safely enter the worksite and be able to join the Local 97 within the first 30 days.


Our current projects include design build hospitals such as Royal Columbian, St.Pauls, and Lionsgate as well as other iconic buildings like Marine Landing and 100 Braid. Most are close to transit and will take two to three years to complete.


Summary of Compensation and benefits:

  • $20 – $37+ per hour depending on experience and certifications.
  • $2/hr incentive pay for meeting weekly jobsite schedule requirements, punctuality, and consistent attendance.
  • 50+ hours per week
  • Full benefits package provided after 250hrs worked.
  • Pension contributions start immediately.


﻿Key Accountabilities/Responsibilities:


Responsibility Area #1 - Supervisory

  • Train, coach, mentor and provide performance feedback to Ironworker Apprentices.
  • Responsible for helping Lead hands, and foremen, ensuring highest level of quality is maintained for each project and completed in accordance with industry standards.
  • Responsible for increasing overall placing crew efficiency.
  • Responsible to implement, as directed by the site foreman, or lead hand, industry practices and procedures that impact A&H’s field placing department.


Responsibility Area #2 - Documentation and Reporting

  • Help implement workflow processes.


Responsibility Area #3 - Health and Safety

  • Ensure all field placing crew adhere to A&H’s Health, Safety and Environment practices and procedures.
  • Responsible to uphold company and placing crew’s standards for cleanliness, workmanship and specifications to ensure they meet legislative and safety code requirements.
  • Responsible for the safety, training, and mentorship of apprentices on the placing crew.


Responsibility Area #4 – Communication and Feedback

  • Responsible for providing improvement feedback on manufacturing efficiencies through innovative approaches to the field foreman, or lead hand.
  • Assist in the development and suggest improvements to practices and procedures to maintain A&H standards for efficient project completions, and a high quality finished product.


Required Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

  • Comprehensive knowledge of the Construction industry.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of OH&S practices, and procedures.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of operating practices and procedures in construction site environment.
  • Effective troubleshooting/problem solving skills.
  • The incumbent must have a valid operator’s license.


Education and Experience:

Note: A combination of education and experience outside of the standards below may also be considered.


Minimum Formal Education:

  • High school diploma
  • Journeyman ironworker trade certification


Professional Designation(s):

  • Journeyman Ironworker

title: HVAC Technician (Service & Install)
description:
We are currently recruiting for licensed and experienced HVAC Technicians to join our team to help service and install HVAC equipment and Indoor Air Quality accessories for our customers, while giving them the Red Carpet Treatment. This career position is a great opportunity for quality, service-minded professionals who are committed to being masters of their trade.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Ensure customers heating, ventilation, and air conditioning equipment meets or exceeds the Technical Standards & Safety Authority’s codes and municipal building codes and standards
  • Follow all Energy Star installation processes and procedures
  • Educate customers on proper care and maintenance and promote all various HVAC options
  • Complete general and specific HVAC equipment inspections
  • Maintain a clean, fully stocked vehicle

Education / Experience / Skills

  • A minimum of 3 years recent HVAC installation experience with exposure to furnaces, central and ductless air conditioners, gas boilers, water heaters including tankless water heaters
  • Valid Gas Fitter/Refrigeration License
  • Valid Driver’s License with a clean record
  • Clear criminal record
  • Comfortable working from heights and using a ladder
  • An accountable and responsible personality, delivering high customer satisfaction and has a positive, can-do attitude
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively within a team environment, completing the installation and commissioning of HVAC elements
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Must be flexible to work weekends, evenings and on call

Benefits
At Haven Home we expect a lot from our technicians. That’s why we’re committed to providing them with industry-leading benefits and compensation that help them improve their job skills, while providing for their families. Some of the benefits include:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Additional incentive earnings available
  • Excellent benefits package
  • RRSP contributions
  • Opportunity for growth
  • Tool allowance
  • Uniforms provided

Join today and grow with us!

We thank all who apply, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Haven Home is an equal opportunity employer.

#PRIORITY1

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Experience:

  • HVAC & Refrigeration Technicians: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license (preferred)
  • Gas Fitters II (preferred)
  • air conditioning & refrigeration license (preferred)
Show more

title: HVAC Lead Installer
description:
****Up to a $5000 Signing Incentive!****

Here at Comfort Masters Heating & Air we strive to provide the best service and products to our customers, as a result, we are looking for, young or old that are currently top performers in their current role and want to join a progressive organization that rewards overachievers.

Do you:

Give customers the red carpet treatment?
Recommend additional services or treatments to make their home more comfortable?
Provide quality service and are committed to being a master of your trade?

Primary Responsibilities

Ensure customers heating, ventilation, and air-condition equipment meets or exceeds the Technical Standards & Safety Authority’s codes and municipal building codes and standards.

· Follow all Energy Star installation processes and procedures.
Educate customers on proper care and maintenance and promote all various HVAC options

· Complete general and specific HVAC equipment inspections

· Maintain a clean, fully stocked vehicle

· Explain the benefits of newer highly efficient equipment to the customer.

· Promote Peel products and services on every call.

· Must never sell the customer a repair they do not need.

· Provide a five-star experience on every call or make it right before leaving the customers home

· Feel comfortable requesting online reviews from customers.

Education/Experience/Skills

· A minimum of 3 years recent HVAC service or Installation experience with exposure to furnaces, central and ductless air conditioners, gas boilers, water heaters including tankless heaters

· Valid Gas Fitter or Refrigeration License

· Valid Driver's License with a clean record

· Clear criminal record

· Comfortable working from heights and using a ladder

· An accountable and responsible personality, delivering high customer

· satisfaction and has a positive, can-do attitude

Ability to work efficiently and effectively within a team environment,

· completing the installation and commissioning of HVAC elements

· Strong customer service skills

· Must be effective at HVAC lead generation and CPP (Customer Protection Plan) enrollments.

· Must have demonstrated strong technical and customer service skills and company metrics in current and previous roles.

Benefits

At Comfort Masters we expect a lot from our technicians. That's why we're committed to providing them with industry-leading benefits and compensation that help them get better at their job while providing for their families, which include:

· Competitive compensation

· Additional incentive earnings available

· Excellent benefits package

· Group RRSP

· Opportunity for growth

· Tool Allowance

· Uniforms provided

#PRIORITY1

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$38.00 per hour

Licence/Certification:

  • Air Conditioning & Refrigeration (preferred)
  • Gas Fitter II or III (preferred)
  • Drivers Licence (required)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: HVAC Technician (Service & Install)
company: Home Aire Care Heating and Cooling
description:
Home Aire Care is looking for HVAC Service Technicians and Installers to join our team in Kingston to help serve our large customer base across eastern region.

Who we are:

We are one of the industry’s longest standing companies with a high focus on providing old and new customers with the best customer experience possible. With over 40 years of experience, Home Aire Care has worked hard to build a solid reputation and solid relationships with our customers and suppliers.

Home Air Care requires energetic, motivated and career-minded HVAC Service Technicians and Installers to be responsible for performing onsite installation and maintenance to HVAC (heating, ventilation, and air conditioning) systems and equipment. He/she will either:

  • work as part of installation team to professionally install HVAC equipment, accessory items, in accordance with manufacturer specifications and local codes. To ensure the safe operation of all new installations and correctly instruct customers on proper care, maintenance.

OR

  • professionally service HVAC equipment, accessory items, in accordance with manufacturer specifications and local codes. Troubleshoot, repair and maintain equipment according to safety, predictive and productive maintenance.

The HVAC Service Technician and Installers shall also be responsible for keeping work areas clean and orderly and for driving Home Aire Care vehicles, maintaining a mobile inventory of parts and tools.

Do you:

  • Give customers the red carpet treatment?
  • Recommend additional services or treatments to make their home more comfortable?
  • Provide quality service and are committed to being a master of your trade?

Primary Responsibilities

  • Ensure customers heating, ventilation, and air-condition equipment meets or exceeds the Technical Standards & Safety Authority’s codes and municipal building codes and standards.
  • Follow all Energy Star installation processes and procedures.
  • Educate customers on proper care and maintenance and promote all various HVAC options
  • Complete general and specific HVAC equipment inspections
  • Maintain a clean, fully stocked vehicle
  • Explain the benefits of newer highly efficient equipment to the customer.
  • Promote AtlasCare products and services on every call.
  • Must never sell the customer a repair they do not need.
  • Provide a five-star experience on every call or make it right before leaving the customers home
  • Feel comfortable requesting online reviews from customers.

Education/Experience/Skills

  • A minimum of 3 years recent HVAC service or Installation experience with exposure to furnaces, central and ductless air conditioners, gas boilers, water heaters including tankless heaters
  • Must have demonstrated strong technical, customer service skills and company metrics in current and previous roles.
  • Must be effective at HVAC lead generation and CPP enrolments.
  • Sheet Metal Fabrication experience
  • Valid Gas Fitter Two/Residential Air Conditioning (313D) License or Apprenticeship
  • Valid Driver's License with a clean record
  • Clear criminal record
  • Comfortable working from heights and using a ladder
  • An accountable and responsible personality, delivering high customer satisfaction and has a positive, can-do attitude
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively within a team environment, completing the installation and commissioning of HVAC elements
  • Strong customer service skills

Benefits

At Home Aire Care we expect a lot from our technicians. That's why we're committed to providing them with industry-leading benefits and compensation that help them get better at their job, while providing for their families, which include:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Additional incentive earnings available
  • Excellent benefits package
  • Group RRSP
  • Opportunity for growth
  • Tool Allowance
  • Uniforms provided

Does this sound like the job for you? If you have the qualifications above, we want to hear from you!

Please let us know of any accommodations required in preparation of your visit as per the Accessibility for Ontarians Disability Act. Home Aire Care is an equal opportunity employer.

#INDPA

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $35.45 per hour

Licence/Certification:

  • Air Conditioning & Refrigeration (preferred)
  • Gas Fitter II (preferred)
  • Drivers Licence (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: HVAC Service Technician - Up to a 10K Sign On Bonus!
description:
*******Up to a $10,000 Signing Bonus!*****

Here at Moore & Russell Heating, we strive to provide the best service and products to our customers, as a result we are looking for young or old that are currently top performers in their current role and want to join a progressive organization that rewards over achievers.

Do you:

  • Give customers the red carpet treatment?
  • Recommend additional services or treatments to make their home more comfortable?
  • Provide quality service and are committed to being a master of your trade?

Primary Responsibilities

  • Ensure customers heating, ventilation, and air-condition equipment meets or exceeds the Technical Standards & Safety Authority’s codes and municipal building codes and standards.
  • Follow all Energy Star installation processes and procedures.
  • Educate customers on proper care and maintenance and promote all various HVAC options
  • Complete general and specific HVAC equipment installations
  • Maintain a clean, fully stocked vehicle
  • Must be effective at HVAC lead generation and CPP enrolments.
  • Must have demonstrated strong technical, customer service skills and company metrics in current and previous roles.

Education/Experience/Skills

  • A minimum of 1 year recent HVAC service or Installation experience with exposure to furnaces, central and ductless air conditioners, gas boilers, water heaters including tankless heaters
  • Explain the benefits of newer highly efficient equipment to the customer.
  • Promote Moore & Russell Heating products and services on every call.
  • Must never sell the customer a repair they do not need.
  • Provide a five-star experience on every call or make it right before leaving the customers home
  • Feel comfortable requesting online reviews from customers.
  • Valid Refrigeration and Air Conditioning License
  • Valid Class B Gas Fitter License
  • Sheet Metal Fabrication experience
  • Valid Driver's License with a clean record
  • Clear criminal record
  • Comfortable working from heights and using a ladder
  • An accountable and responsible personality, delivering high customer satisfaction and has a positive, can-do attitude
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively within a team environment, completing the installation and commissioning of HVAC elements
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Verbal Communication in Mandarin and/or Cantonese (asset)

Benefits

At Moore & Russell Heating, we expect a lot from our installers. That's why we're committed to providing them with industry-leading benefits and compensation that help them get better at their job, while providing for their families, which include:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Additional incentive earnings available
  • Excellent benefits package
  • Group RRSP
  • Opportunity for growth
  • Tool Allowance
  • Uniforms provided

#PRIORITY1

Please note that this position requires a Criminal Background Check be completed for potential candidates - paid by employer. This check must be satisfactory in order for an employment offer to be extended unconditionally.

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Application question(s):

  • Are you currently legally able to work in Canada?
  • Do you have a clear criminal record?

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license (required)
  • Gas Fitter (preferred)
  • air conditioning & refrigeration license (preferred)
Show more

title: HVAC Installer
description:
Romaniuk Heating & Air Conditioning requires energetic, motivated and career-minded HVAC Install Technicians working in Residential applications to be responsible for performing onsite Installations (heating, ventilation, and air conditioning) systems and equipment. Apprentices welcome.

He/she will:

  • professionally install HVAC equipment, accessory items, in accordance with manufacturer specifications and local codes. Troubleshoot, repair and maintain equipment according to safety, predictive and productive maintenance.
  • preventative and corrective maintenance, inspections, modifications, installation/dismantling of systems and projects; and troubleshooting, diagnosing and repairs of commercial equipment.

The Residential HVAC Technician shall also be responsible for working independently, keeping work areas clean and orderly and for driving Romaniuk vehicles, maintaining a mobile inventory of parts and tools.

Do you:

  • Give customers the red-carpet treatment?
  • Recommend additional services or treatments to make their home more comfortable?
  • Provide quality service and are committed to being a master of your trade?

Primary Responsibilities include:

  • Ensure customers heating, ventilation, and air-condition equipment meets or exceeds municipal building codes and standards.
  • Follow all Energy Star installation processes and procedures.
  • Educate customers on proper care and maintenance and promote all various HVAC options
  • Complete general and specific HVAC equipment inspections
  • Maintain all facility logbooks as per schedule requirements
  • Maintain a clean, fully stocked vehicle
  • Explain the benefits of newer highly efficient equipment to the customer.
  • Promote Romaniuk products and services on every call.
  • Must never sell the customer a repair or service they do not need.
  • Provide a five-star experience on every call or make it right before leaving the customers home
  • Feel comfortable requesting online reviews from customers.

Education/Experience/Skills

  • A minimum of 3 years recent HVAC service or install experience with exposure to furnaces, central and ductless air conditioners, gas boilers, water heaters including tankless heaters.
  • Certified Alberta Journeyman in an appropriate Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning trade and Gas ticket required.
  • Must have demonstrated strong technical, customer service skills and company metrics in current and previous roles.
  • Must be effective at HVAC lead generation and CPP enrolments.
  • If you are an apprentice, must be at least a 3rd year.
  • Sheet Metal Fabrication experience an asset
  • Valid Gas Fitter B Certificate
  • Valid Class Five (5) Alberta Driver's License with a clean record
  • Clear criminal record
  • Comfortable working from heights and using a ladder
  • An accountable and responsible personality, delivering high customer satisfaction and has a positive, can-do attitude
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively within a team environment, completing the installation and commissioning of HVAC elements
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Satisfactory Background Check

Benefits

At Romaniuk we expect a lot from our technicians. That's why we're committed to providing them with industry-leading benefits and compensation that help them get better at their job, while providing for their families, which include:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Additional incentive earnings available
  • Excellent benefits package
  • Opportunity for growth
  • Tool Allowance
  • Uniforms provided

Does this sound like the job for you? If you have the qualifications above, we want to hear from you!

Please note that this position requires a Criminal Background Check be completed for potential candidates. This check must be satisfactory in order for an employment offer to be extended unconditionally.

#PRIORITY1

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Experience:

  • HVAC & Refrigeration Technicians: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license (preferred)
Show more

title: Licensed HVAC Installer
description:
RB Heating ClimateCare is a well established HVAC company in Kemptville. We have been in business for almost 30 years and plan to be around for a long time to come. RB Heating ClimateCare is currently looking for a Licensed HVAC/Fireplace Installer. This position will install all types of HVAC equipment and Indoor Air Quality Accessories for our customers, while giving them the Red Carpet Treatment. This is a great opportunity for a quality, service-minded professional who is committed to being a master of their trade.. Whether you have 10 years of experience or just out of school with a G2 please contact us- we'd love to chat with you.

If you are reading this and think Kemptville is too far- please consider the following things about our location: We are an easy 20 min drive from Barrhaven and 25 min from Kanata with clear highway sailing- NO TRAFFIC! Kemptville has also become a hot real estate market with lots of people moving from Ottawa to get access to larger properties.

Why work for RB Heating ClimateCare:

  • Competitive Compensation based on experience
  • Overtime over 8 hours per day
  • 100% paid health and dental benefits
  • RRSP Share Program (after 5 years)
  • Paid Vacation, Birthday OFF with PAY
  • Complimentary uniforms, boot allowance and tool replacement
  • Paid Training and Coursework
  • Our team works all year round
  • Great teamwork environment

Roles and responsibilities:

  • Install residential HVAC systems/equipment such as furnaces, air conditioners, hot water tanks, boilers, geothermal, HRVs and water treatment.
  • Process customer payments.
  • Provide training to junior technicians as appropriate.
  • Maintain and uphold health and safety practices while on all job sites including proper dealing with carbon dioxide, natural gas, propane & oil.
  • Conform to all municipal and utility codes and quality standards of the Company to ensure gases and HVAC equipment are handled with care.

Requirements:

  • 2 years of residential experience preferred not mandatory
  • Gas fitters II (G2) license
  • Valid Driver’s License and Insurance
  • Knowledge of gas codes, safety requirements and transportation of dangerous goods
  • Ability to problem solve, multi-task and adaptable to shifting demands
  • Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$30.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
We follow the latest government regulations to ensure the safety of our staff and customers.

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Ottawa, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Do you have a valid Driver's license? (preferred)
  • Do you have a valid Gas Fitter II (G2) License? (preferred)
  • How many years of Residential HVAC experience do you have? (preferred)
Show more

This position will install all types of HVAC equipment and Indoor Air Quality Accessories for our customers, while giving them the Red Carpet Treatment. This is a great opportunity for a quality, service-minded professional who is committed to being a master of their trade.

Position: FULL TIME

To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • 2 years’ experience.
  • Gas fitters II (G2) license.
  • Valid driver’s license and insurance.
  • Excellent knowledge of gas codes, safety requirements and transportation of dangerous goods.
  • Proven problem solving.
  • Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.
  • Strong multi-tasking skills with the ability to keep up with shifting demands.
  • Team player.

RB Heating ClimateCare is a member of ClimateCare- Ontario’s largest HVAC co-operative, an independent network of trained and expert heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) contractors.

We offer excellent compensation, comprehensive benefits, an outstanding work environment/culture, and much more!

Interested candidates are encouraged to complete our application form. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: HVAC Lead Technician - Install
description:
We are currently recruiting for licensed and experienced HVAC Technicians to join our team to help service and install HVAC equipment and Indoor Air Quality accessories for our customers, while giving them the Red Carpet Treatment.

This career position is a great opportunity for quality, service-minded professionals who are committed to being masters of their trade.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Ensure customers heating, ventilation, and air conditioning equipment meets or exceeds the Technical Standards & Safety Authority’s codes and municipal building codes and standards
  • Follow all Energy Star installation processes and procedures
  • Educate customers on proper care and maintenance and promote all various HVAC options
  • Complete general and specific HVAC equipment inspections
  • Maintain a clean, fully stocked vehicle

Education / Experience / Skills

  • A minimum of 3 years recent HVAC installation experience with exposure to furnaces, central and ductless air conditioners, gas boilers, water heaters including tankless water heaters
  • Valid Gas Fitter/Refrigeration License
  • Valid Driver’s License with a clean record
  • Clear criminal record
  • Comfortable working from heights and using a ladder
  • An accountable and responsible personality, delivering high customer satisfaction and has a positive, can-do attitude
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively within a team environment, completing the installation and commissioning of HVAC elements
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Must be flexible to work weekends, evenings and on call

Benefits

At Home Aire Care we expect a lot from our technicians. That’s why we’re committed to providing them with industry-leading benefits and compensation that help them improve their job skills, while providing for their families. Some of the benefits include:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Additional incentive earnings available
  • Excellent benefits package
  • RRSP contributions
  • Opportunity for growth
  • Tool allowance
  • Uniforms provided

Home Aire Care is preparing to grow in the Kingston & Trenton market, join today and grow with us!

To apply, please contact Kevin Dentremont kevin.dentremont@homeairecare.ca

We thank all who apply, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Home Aire Care is an equal opportunity employer.
